DOC.brief_summary: This study design test hypotheses incentive increase participation smoke cessation treatment result cessation rate offer Medicaid BadgerCare Plus member .
DOC.detailed_description: Aim 1 : To determine extent contingent financial `` treatment incentive '' ( i.e. , incentives biochemical verification visit , treatment engagement , abstinence ) versus `` attendance incentive '' ( i.e. , incentive attend biochemical verification visit ) , increase rate smoke cessation . Participants BadgerCare Plus tobacco user enroll Wisconsin Tobacco Quit Line ( WTQL ) service . Aim 2 : To determine extent treatment incentives vs. attendance incentive increase rate engagement smoke cessation treatment WTQL offer BadgerCare Plus member smoke . Aim 3 : To determine cost‐effectiveness smoke cessation program pair treatment incentive pair attendance incentive . Aim 4 : To identify moderate mediational effect regard clinical benefit incentivized smoking treatment Aim 5 : To determine reach incentivized smoking cessation treatment depend upon primary care clinic staff , fax‐to‐quit referral mechanism state quit line .
DOC.criteria: enrollment Wisconsin Medicaid ( BadgerCare Plus ) reside study area ( one 25 county ) member participate HMOs 18 old English speaking smoke daily ( least 5 cigarette day ) last week willingness attend visit his/her PCC ( primary care clinic ) every 6 month ( 3 time 12 month period ) , provide urine sample , complete followup phone call willingness inform WTQL change address , phone number , clinic attend , health plan . enrolled Wisconsin Medicaid ( BadgerCare Plus ) reside study area member participate HMOs le 18 year age English speak smoke daily ( least 5 cigarette day ) last week willing attend visit his/her PCC ( primary care clinic ) every 6 month ( 3 time 12 month period ) , provide urine sample , complete followup phone call . willing inform WTQL change address , phone number , clinic attend , health plan .
